deepseek.name: DeepSeek
deepseek.description: DeepSeek AI assistant, supports deep thinking and web search

glm.name: GLM
glm.description: Zhipu Qingyan AI assistant, supports GLM-5 flagship model, deep thinking and video generation

kimi.name: Kimi
kimi.description: Kimi AI assistant, supports long text processing and web search
kimi.accessTokenPlaceholder: Enter Kimi Access Token or Refresh Token
kimi.accessTokenHelp: Supports JWT Token (starts with eyJ) or refresh_token

minimax.name: MiniMax
minimax.description: MiniMax Hailuo AI, supports voice conversation and agents
minimax.tokenPlaceholder: Enter MiniMax JWT Token (starts with eyJ)
minimax.tokenHelp: JWT Token obtained from browser developer tools
minimax.jwtTokenHelp: Get from browser DevTools -> Application -> Local Storage -> agent.minimaxi.com -> _token
minimax.realUserIDHelp: If left empty, will extract from JWT Token. If authentication fails, please enter the correct Real User ID manually

qwen.name: Qwen
qwen.description: Tongyi Qianwen AI assistant by Alibaba Cloud, supports deep thinking and code modes
qwen.ssoTicketHelp: SSO Ticket obtained from Qwen website (www.qianwen.com), found in browser DevTools Application -> Cookies as tongyi_sso_ticket
qwen.deepThinkingDesc: Enable deep thinking mode for more thorough reasoning analysis
qwen.codeModeDesc: Use Qwen-Coder model, specialized for programming tasks

qwen-ai.name: Qwen AI (International)
qwen-ai.description: Qwen AI international version (chat.qwen.ai), supports thinking mode with reasoning output
qwen-ai.tokenHelp: JWT token obtained from chat.qwen.ai Local Storage (key: "token")
qwen-ai.cookiesHelp: Full cookie string from browser DevTools (optional but recommended)
qwen-ai.thinkingModeDesc: Enable thinking mode to get reasoning process before answer

zai.name: Z.ai
zai.description: Z.ai - Free AI Chatbot powered by GLM-5 and GLM-4.7
zai.tokenHelp: Get token from Z.ai cookie (token) or localStorage, starts with "eyJ..."

proxy.title: Proxy Settings
proxy.description: Configure API proxy service parameters and management policies
proxy.basicConfigDesc: Configure basic parameters for proxy service
proxy.advancedConfigDesc: Configure timeout, retry, and logging options
proxy.autoStartHelp: Automatically start proxy service when app launches
proxy.modelMappingDesc: Map request models to actual models used

proxy.wildcardMappingDesc: Support using * as wildcard to match multiple models
proxy.addMappingDesc: Configure request model to actual model mapping rules
proxy.requestModelHelp: Model name requested by client, supports wildcard *
proxy.actualModelHelp: Actual model name sent to provider
proxy.requestActualModelRequired: Request model and actual model cannot be empty
proxy.mappingExists: Mapping rule already exists for this request model
proxy.configSaveFailed: Failed to save configuration, please try again
proxy.invalidIpOrHostname: Please enter a valid IP address or hostname
proxy.bindAddressHelp: 0.0.0.0 allows all network access, 127.0.0.1 for local only
proxy.enableCorsHelp: Allow cross-origin requests to access proxy service
proxy.corsOriginHelp: Use * to allow all origins, or comma-separate multiple domains
proxy.fixFormErrors: Please fix the errors in the form
proxy.loadBalanceConfigDesc: Configure account selection strategy and weight distribution
proxy.roundRobinDesc: Use each available account in sequence for even request distribution
proxy.fillFirstDesc: Prioritize current account until limit reached, then switch to next
proxy.failoverDesc: Automatically skip failed accounts. Switch to other accounts after 3 consecutive failures, auto-recover after 1 minute
proxy.weightHelp: Higher weight means higher probability of selection. Only effective in round-robin strategy.
proxy.addAndActivateAccount: Please add and activate accounts first
proxy.timeoutHelp: Maximum wait time for a single request (1-300 seconds)
proxy.retryCountMustBeNumber: Retry count must be a number
proxy.retryCountHelp: Automatic retry count after request failure (0-10 times)
proxy.debugLevelDesc: Output all logs, suitable for development debugging
proxy.infoLevelDesc: Output info level and above logs
proxy.warnLevelDesc: Output warning and error logs only
proxy.retentionDaysMustBeNumber: Retention days must be a number
proxy.logRetentionHelp: Logs older than this will be automatically cleaned up (1-365 days)

apiKeys.confirmDeleteDesc: This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to delete this API Key?

about.tagline: Multi-platform AI Service Unified Management Tool
about.credits: Made with ❤️ by the Open Source Community
about.builtWith: Built with Electron, React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Zustand, Koa and other amazing open source projects.

prompts.title: Function Calling Simulation
prompts.description: Enables tool calling for models without native Function Calling support
prompts.toolUseDescription: Full Function Calling capability via Prompt Engineering
prompts.toolUseIntro: Function Calling allows AI models to invoke external tools and APIs during conversations. Through Prompt Engineering and stream parsing, the system provides complete tool calling functionality for all supported models without relying on native Function Calling APIs.
prompts.howItWorksDesc: 1. Protocol Definition: Design a text protocol [function_calls][call:name]{args}[/call][/function_calls] that models can easily understand. 2. Prompt Injection: Convert OpenAI-format tools definitions into System Prompt. 3. Output Interception: Real-time interception of protocol text during streaming. 4. Format Restoration: Extract protocol content and wrap as OpenAI-format tool_calls.
prompts.supportedModelsDesc: DeepSeek, GLM, Kimi, Qwen, MiniMax, Z.ai and all built-in providers now support Function Calling.
prompts.protocolFormatDesc: Models output [function_calls] blocks containing [call:name]{json}[/call] format calls. The system automatically parses and converts them to OpenAI-compatible tool_calls format.
